meanings.definition: The final stage of an insect's metamorphosis, in which it has reached its adult form.
meanings.sent1: After the caterpillar and pupa stages, the imagoes emerges as a fully grown butterfly.
meanings.sent2: The imagoes of the dragonfly is a beautiful sight to behold.
meanings.sent3: The imagoes of the butterfly decided to throw a party to celebrate its transformation.
meanings.sent4: The imagoes of the insect burst forth from its cocoon like a colorful flower blooming.
meanings.sent5: The children watched in awe as the imagoes of the moth fluttered gracefully in the garden.

meanings.definition: An idealized mental image of someone, especially a parent, that influences a person's behavior.
meanings.sent1: Her imagoes of her father as a hero motivated her to always strive for excellence.
meanings.sent2: The imagoes of a perfect mother can have a profound impact on a person's life.
meanings.sent3: His imagoes of his boss as a superhero made him laugh every time he saw him.
meanings.sent4: The imagoes of a loving family can be a guiding light in times of darkness.
meanings.sent5: She carried the imagoes of her grandmother's wisdom with her wherever she went.
